Steps to Reproduce
---------------------------------------
1.Carry over Stylish installation from ff4.1 to nightly while disabled.
2.Enable stylish then install this style http://userstyles.org/styles/46613/animated-fun
3.Attempt to access User Styles in the add-ons Manager

What should have happened:
---------------------------------------
It should have come up with a list of User Styles to activate/disable



What actually happened:
----------------------------------------
The buton on the left highlighted but there was no change to the right hand window.

comments.text:
Stylish is an addon that allows you to customize how FF looks, both chrome appearance (hiding title bar, button styles, etc) and websites (skins for websites, etc).
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/stylish/
http://userstyles.org/

This problem also exists with userscripts, I can install them for use with Greasemonkey/Scriptish, but can't view them in the addons area.
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/greasemonkey/
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/scriptish/
http://userscripts.org/

In Aurora, the User Scripts and User Style tabs show the last selected tab (Extensions/Appearance/Plugins) and Nightly shows nothing whatsoever.

I can't see any attachment links so I'll upload screenshots to a hosting server later.


------------------------------------------------------

Also, unrelated to this bug, my Aurora doesn't update as it should.

1) I can't switch the update channel to release/beta/aurora because the tab/button doesn't show anymore. This is the second time it's happened and the only fix has been to delete my entire profile and start from scratch because resetting preferences and disabling all addons via safemode screen has had no effect (did this when version changed from moz 5.0 to 6.0).

2) Now 6.0 keeps reverting to (2011-06-18) whenever I reboot but I don't want to go through the entire process again.
